text: An Arab tribe in Lebanon. Banu Al-Mashrouki is a branch of the Hamadan tribe in Lebanon. ==In Lebanon== Banu Al-Mashrouki settled in Lebanon producing well known Maronite influential families such as the Awwad, Massa'ad, Al-Sema'ani mainly establishing Hasroun The Hasroun website and Tanbourit The Tanbourit website *Another branch of Bani Al-Mashrouki (Banu Al Harith) remained in Jabal Amil and were mainly Shia. A smaller group joined the Yemeni Druze and were eventually pushed by Kaysi Druze to Jabal Al Druze in Syria. ==Mashrouki Maronite Patriarchs== *Youssef al Sem'ani (1687-1768) *Yaqoub Awwad (1705-1733) *Sem'an Aawwad (1743-1756) *Boulos Massead (1854-1890) *Youhanna El Hajj (1817-1898) ==Notes== Category:Tribes of Arabia Category:Shia communities
title: Banu Al-Mashrouki
